first_reasoning: Allocating the $10 million to the Industrial Products Division offers the most reliable path to meaningful earnings lift. We have two committed pilot customers and a conservatively modeled ramp that can deliver $1.5–2 million of incremental profit in year two and $3.5–4 million in year three. Though the consumer market could deliver quicker payoffs, its high volatility and lower margins make it a riskier bet. The industrial opportunity is backed by firm orders and proven technical feasibility, making it the superior risk-adjusted investment.
second_reasoning: Concentrating the full $20 million on the Industrial Products Division gives us the scale needed to overcome key technical hurdles and develop a truly differentiated platform. Prior smaller allocations failed to move the needle, whereas a single, large‐scale investment can drive high‐value contracts, multi-year service agreements, and meaningful margin recovery. Splitting the funds again would dilute impact and leave both divisions stuck in loss–making inertia.
